Reviews.Title: “accommodation was good”
Reviews.Author: Charli_32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Al Vagon in early March 2011 during the Venice Carnivale, it was the only hotel we could find to meet our budget and we were slightly worried because it was only a 2 star hotel, room only. When we finally found Hotel Al Vagon from the instructions and directions that we were given, it was quite late at night (past midnight). I think we would have found the hotel quicker if we were in daylight, but after being dropped at the Rialtto Bridge it took a few wrong turnings before we finally found our way there. The hotel was open and someone was waiting for us to show us to our room, which was across the street and up two flights of stairs. The room was amazing. High ceilings, nice decor, large sash windows, comfy bed, spacious, large bathroom with shower cubicle. The only thing that the hotel did not have was a kettle to make drinks and as the hotel did not offer these, it would be advisable if you were staying here to mabye pack your own. As we visited during Winter, the hotel's restaurant along the canal was not open. However, we found a little cafe is a small Piazza opposite that we made full use of especially in the mornings for coffee and breakfast and a snack for mid morning. They did a lovely hot coffee and my favourite breakfast from there was pancakes with bananas and nuttella. The location was a good location, it was fairly central to most attractions in Venice, including the train station, Rialtto Bridge, St Marks Square, etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel as we found the owner to be very friendly and able to answer all our queries, assist us to find places etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, value for money, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Nishbarni
Reviews.Content: Hi We stayed at Hotel Al Vagon in the Month of July for two days. The best thing about the hotel is its staff which is very friendly. The hotel is a no-frills hotel with not a lot to call for as room-service but still the staff is helpful in terms of guiding you etc. The location is nice being very close to the City square & Rialto bridge. The only problem is finding the hotel itself since it is hidden somewhere in the lanes. The rooms were clean and there were enough eating places nearby including Hotel's own restaurant. The room rates are pretty cheap and i feel we got a good value for what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Pearl amongst so many traps in Venice”
Reviews.Author: gGzin
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend found o Al Vagon online and the reviews on TA were great so we decided to make a reservation. I've been to Venice before and ended up paying too much for a lousy room and I was expecting Al Vagon to be the same since I've heard it happens a lot in Venice if you are not willy to pay super high prices. We arrived in Venice with the address and we had a little bit of difficulty to get there and had to stop to check online for a map. We thought we could walk but it is really worth taking the boat bus. When we arrived we were surprised by the quality of the room and the cleanliness. Plus, we had a room with a window to one of the canals which was awesome! Unfortunately we had a major discussion with the owner of the beat down dinner right by the hotel over a very stupid issue. The owner was EXTREMELY rude and wanted to kick us out and threatened us. When the owner of the hotel heard of this, he went over to talk to the owner of the restaurant and understand why he had been such an idiot and told us that the guy is the problem in the neighborhood. He was very kind to us and helped us resolve the issue. Other than the dinner right by the hotel, we would definitely recommend the hotel and stay there again and thank the owner once again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: il0veeur0pe
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Al Vagon. Great location & very friendly staff. This was a very small room, but wasn't a big deal because we were out sightseeing all day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it1”
Reviews.Author: Mags M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Al Vagon for 3 nights and I could not have been more pleased. The location is perfect and very easy to find, which as a previous reviewer mentioned, is rare in Venice. The room was lovely and immaculately clean, and the staff were both friendly and helpful. Also, and this was so appreciated in stiflingly hot Venice, the AC absolutely rocked! By far my favorite (it was also the cheapest) hotel of my three week trip through Italy.

Reviews.Title: “the worst service we have ever recieved”
Reviews.Author: matt_bekah
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel during our anniversary trip through Italy. we booked, and payed for a canal view, which we did not receive, but instead had a view of a noisy courtyard. before we even saw our room, we were taken aback by the rude host, who answered our questions with curt, short sentences, and even ignored some of our questions all together. when we were showed to our room, we told him it was unacceptable since we had been told that we would be getting a canal view. he claimed to have emailed us a week earlier, to let us know that instead of getting a canal view, we would be getting a room with a "four poster bed" which was cost equivalent. woo hoo. that is not why we came to Venice. we did not receive that email, and even if they had sent it, we had been in Italy for well over a week by the time we got there. we have traveled quite a bit since being together, and we always use trip advisor, and we have never ever given a 1 out of 5 for a review. but this was the worst service we have experienced yet. the room was clean and adequate, but the service was so bad that it made the whole place upsetting. as a side note: you much visit Burano which is only a 30 minute ferry ride. we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably good”
Reviews.Author: HardyBM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an extended weekend. Management were lovely and very helpful - great for a pair of Anglos that spoke nil Italian. Room was quiet, clean and quite pretty. Room had everything we needed and nothing we didn't; no view but didn't expect one! Would recommend to everyone and plan to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An awful way to start to our visit to Venice!”
Reviews.Author: JRCUk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to Italy for a friends wedding. Myself and my boyfriend were travelling with friends and had booked 1 night at the Hotel Al Vagon in Venice. We arrived at the hotel ready for our 2pm check- in. When we approached the reception of the hotel we were greeted by a very unfriendly man who proceded to tell us our booking had been cancelled due to a pre- authorised card error even though we were going to be paying by cash! He then said he had given our rooms away and that was how things worked in his hotel. As you can imagine I was extremally upset by this as we had been travelling for most of the day from Lake Garda and were looking forward to a relaxing afternoon in Venice. I asked the man why he had not contacted us about this error and he said it was not his problem. At this point I asked him if he had any other rooms and he said he had 1- the more expensive superior room which I thought was convenient! I asked about our friends- at this point he got very nasty and said he was unwilling to help us as I was rude and not a 'good' person. Whilst I was talking to the rude man another guest staying in the hotel passed a card to us saying to call them as it was details for a friendlier, cheaper hotel- the man said he would be 'having words with her later'! He seemed very aggressive and I didn't feel at all comfortable being in this situation. My boyfriend tried to calm the situation and the man said he could get a room for our friends in another hotel although we would need to sign and pay for this 100 euro room first. I said I wanted to see the other hotel first as we were away with our friends and it didn't seem right to be split up if we were going to be miles apart in different hotels. He told us to leave our cases whilst he showed us- we said we would prefer to keep them with us for safety. He snapped at us for thinking 'his' hotel was unsafe! We followed him to the other 'hotel' which was situated down an dirty back alley way, through a huge gate to a random door. I felt quite scared at this point as there were no other people around and we had no idea where he had led us. He rang the bell and at that point I thought this seemed odd as there was no hotel sign and the door wasn't free to open. We said that we were not willing to have this hotel. He shouted something in Italian at us and stormed off. All in all this was a nightmare start to our trip away. Luckily we booked into a lovely little hotel that was cheaper and had very friendly and helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Very Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: jesso34
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good - about 15 minutes from Rialto bridge and 20 minutes from San Marco Square. We took the Vaporetto (spend the money for a unlimited ride card) from the train station which took about 25 minutes. The hotel was not hard to find and it included a small, very small TV, AC and WiFi. However, the staff were very rude and provided an unpleasant experience for myself and my family. On the last night, when we went to check out, the front desk man refused to give us the VAT receipt, stating that it was included in the price and could not be broken down. My mother then went on to ask to use the "wheelchair" lift to get up the 20+ stairs (there is no elevator) in which the man asked rudely why she waited until the last night to ask to use the machine. He also stated that he would have to look for the remote and he was not going to do that. Therefore, my mother, highly embarrassed, with her bad knees, had to walk up the stairs with no sympathy from the staff. I would also suggest not booking a "canal" view as it seems like only one room on each floor has a decent canal view worth the money. The location is good but other than that, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: Jantorthrax
Reviews.Content: The location is brilliant, easy walk to the main tourist attractions. It is easy to find which is a little unusual for Venice. If you want a great room ask for a canal view with balcony. The view was great and really made the room and really justified the expense. Its not the cheapest accommodation but is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Spacious”
Reviews.Author: Ytinrete
Reviews.Content: This was the largest room we stayed at in Italy and enjoyed having the extra space. We were a short walk from the Rialto bridge which was nice for sightseeing but is a pain to get your luggage to the hotel!. We took the shuttle boat from the train station to the rialto to get there and from the rialto to the airport when we left. We were on a floor above the restaurant and would recommend asking for a higher floor if possible because you can hear the noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wstonum
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location and is easy to get to from the airport. It was a little noisy in the room on the canal when you left the window open. Overall a great experience

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and a balcony!”
Reviews.Author: Afralique
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor and it had some very rave reviews so we decided to give it a go and were well rewarded. The location was super convenient it was easy to get our luggage in from the airport was close to Rialto bridge, San Marco and what seemed like an endless choice of restaurants for dinner as well as a supermarket. We never got lost once and found that being able to simply follow signs from anywhere in venice back to Rialto made transversing the city a breeze. The owner is very friendly and ready to help if you need it, and to top it all off our little hotel room no.2 had a balcony overlooking a canal and bridge which was a blessing, but be aware the canal view makes the room a little louder as the street noise travels down the canals quite loudly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKALondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Vagon is our number one choice for Venice. We have always found the service excellent and this time was no exception. We arrived to be told the "acqua alta" was expected each morning of our stay but not to go and buy boots, they had some we could borrow. A good thing too, we wouldn't have been able to leave the room for breakfast without them the first morning.

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect until twilight”
Reviews.Author: MistaTripsta
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Al Vagon because of it's central location and because of the great price. Our room was really nice, not only compared with what you usually get for that price in Venice. The interior was quite recently renovated and in good shape, obviously filled with a lot of "venetian style" decoration but still very nice and cosy. The bathroom was large, very clean and also in very good shape. The only two negative points are concerning the noise level: The walls must be made of paper, we could hear every giggle of our young and not very silent neighbours. The windows of the room weren't very great either; our room was facing to the street, right opposite to a juice bar that was open from 8 in the morning until 2 at night. Unfortunately their music player was constantly playing annoving music at high volume. From two until four in the morning (Saturday night) we had different drunk and psychopathic teenagers under our window bellowing in continuation. I still would recommend this hotel as it offers a very nice room in central venice at a great price. Just make sure to bring your earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, great hotel, just a bit noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Wrxpc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, on one of the main walks through to the Rialto Bridge. Once you get the hang of the street signs telling you which way to go it's easy to find your way out to the major attractions and back to this hotel. We stayed in one of the larger rooms overlooking the canal, and that was really pretty special except for the traffic ... yes, traffic! There were boats going up and down the canals until quite late at night and starting quite early in the morning, and there was also a lot of activity unloading supplies for the resturant down below. The other noise issue was that the walls seem to be quite thin in European hotels, and this one was no exception. We could quite clearly hear the people in the room next door as they came and went, and slammed the door every time they did so :-(

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: erikwallin
Reviews.Content: Close to the Rialto Bridge and good location for the shopping, little away from the city centre but very close to the public transportation. Rooms not large but recently renovated and clean, bed little hard. Good value for money considering the location. Rude check in guy, but in finally we want to stay again for the budget price.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, clean, great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: sailorlass
Reviews.Content: 5 minuted from the Rialto Bridge, a good little cafe in the same square, clean, comfortable, quiet, good shower and bed, what more do you need? Pleasant decor, small, but a good price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, great view, clean room”
Reviews.Author: Allycat789
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to Ponte Rialto, a main attraction in Venice, which made it really easy to navigate around the city. There are signs everywhere pointing you back toward Rialto. The room itself was very clean, comfortable bed, and our window overlooked a canal. It was absolutely lovely. Breakfast wasn't included, which would have been nice because every other hotel we stayed at in Italy provided a small breakfast. But that is just a minor suggestion for improvement. No complaints from us about this hotel. Not a bad price, either.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, good value”
Reviews.Author: FrancesandTom
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Al Vagon. Our room was spacious and very clean. The location is perfect - step outside the hotel and you're right in the heart of Venice. Good value for money considering the location. No breakfast supplied, but this is a good thing! Who wants to sit in a hotel eating cornflakes when you can go and find delicious pastries and coffee and soak up the sights of Venice?

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: liferaft
Reviews.Content: Finding a "budget" hotel in Venice is serious work but the Hotel Al Vagon fits the bill. It has large, clean rooms and a great location. Its web site provides excellent directions, finding your way around when first arriving is a challenge. The staff is helpful although one day they forgot to change our towels but upon asking they were immediately there. Credit cards are accepted.

Reviews.Title: “superb location... decent room”
Reviews.Author: kris_reviews
Reviews.Content: Okay...I had zeroed in on al vagon after going through tons of Tripadvisor reviews, and they were mostly positive and any doubts i may have had was put to rest once i landed in the hotel. It is literally a 5 minute walk from the vaperrato station Ca'daro and about 10-15 minutes walk to st. marco's square and all other attractions I had received directions to reach the hotel from their reception and it wa spsot on. Didn't have to look for it at all. Mind you, this hotel doesn't have an elevator, so you will have to lug your luggage up 2-3 floors. The rooms was small, but the bathroom was extremely clean and the guys attended and cleaned the room everyday. No breakfast in this hotel but, we did manage to locate plenty of breakfast joints in and around the place. There is once just next to the hotel but it's not good at all, i found the food stale. Kumar, the guy at the reception was very helpful and was happy to accomodate any queries clarifications we needed. I did feel the hotel was overpriced. But if you look at it in totality in terms of location/venice being and expensive city, then i guess you might pass it off as a small premium you may be paying. Overall, i would give this hotel a thumbs up! If you are planning Venice, then go for this guys... :)

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station Santa Lucia, next to a canal”
Reviews.Author: Flying-sunshine
Reviews.Content: It's a good choice if you're looking for something not too far from the train station. We had a very hard time finding the hotel though. As if Venice is not complicated enough, the address given is not the street name but the area. We asked many people on the street to guide us, but they had never heard of that hotel! So here's the directions from the train station Santa Lucia: Take the vaporetto line #1, get off at the stop Ca' d'Oro. Walk to Strada Nova and turn right. Walk toward S.S. Apostoli. In front of the church Apostoli, cross the bridge. You'll see the restaurant Al Vagon next to the water. The reception is on the other side of the building. And a little advice: DON'T eat at the restaurant. It's expensive with bad service and disgusting food. My boyfriend even found a hair is his pasta! The vaporetto ride takes about 10 min. and the walk to the hotel (if you don't get lost) takes about 7 min. The room was pretty, over looking the water. Another advice: close your curtains. We left it open during the day while we took a nap and I woke up with a little old lady staring at me from the window across ours! The shower was weird, since it was all in the open, water would go everywhere and the entire bathroom floor would be flooded after we took a shower. It's a good bargain and close to Piazza San Marco and Rialto Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ABBranco
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central in an area that allows us to orient our entire visit to the city. Is close to restaurants and bars which makes it much easier to feed because it doesnÂ´t offers breakfast service. The street is very busy but closed the windows and shutters do not hear any noise. The room was spacious enough to allow even a good accommodation for a couple with one child. It was nice and comfortable. We treated all over the Internet which was very advantageous and facilitated. We really enjoyed our stay at the Al Vagon and recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Top value for great location and lots of room to relax”
Reviews.Author: BradKT
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice in this hotel now. This is one of the best value hotels in Venice, very centrally located, but very affordable. The rooms are spacious (especially compared to the shoebox sized rooms in some Venice hotels), private, quiet, and well appointed. The hotel offers accommodation only, with no room service and few other facilities, but the location and proximity to everything really balances that out with access to numerous restaurants, bars, cafes, and less than five minutes walk to the Rialto Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: neyhc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, near Rialto Bridge, and the room is nice enough, clean and with air conditioning _VERY important if you're in Venice during the summer. My room faced an internal patio, so noise was not a problem. That's it, though: no internet, breakfast, or anything else. If you want more comfort (and are willing to pay more), I'm sure there are better places in Venice. Al Vagon is good enough for a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and a good location at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: LuciePat
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by how nice our room was for the rate. Exposed beams, high ceilings, a canopied bed, and a beautiful glass chandelier. The bathroom and shower were nice.. We had planned to switch to a room in another building on the canal side but opted to stay put. The large shuttered windows looked out on a busy little piazza which was occasionally noisy. But the room had a.c. so we could choose to close the windows. Though it wasn't as cool as the a.c. we're used to, we were comfortable. Our last evening there I realized I desperately needed to get into my email and the Internet cafe around the corner had closed; the concierge graciously allowed me to use his computer. Nice! The location is maybe a 10-15 minute walk to St. Mark's and a very short walk to good shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE BUT VERY NOISY”
Reviews.Author: fandorin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Al Vagon for 4 nights. The hotel is in great location. Easy to get to from the airport. Not far from vaporetto station and very close to Rialto Bridge. The only problem is a noisy juice parlour in the same building, which is usually open till late hours (2 nights till 2am!), which makes it difficult to sleep as you need windows open in this climate. Overall very fine though.

Reviews.Title: “It's a very good hotel ! I recommend you !!!”
Reviews.Author: NewSee
Reviews.Content: It is a very good Hotel, let me suggest it to you. We have spent 3 nights int he Al Vagon Hotel with my husband. We arrived early but even so we could leave there our luggage and we could use a toilette. The gentleman working at the reception was very helpful all the time. The window of our room looked on the yard but this was specially OK because because of the silence, (Room 30). Though the room and the bathroom was little they were very very clean. It was perfectly satisfying for the requirements of a tourist (having a bath and sleeping) after a long day of sight seing. We have received a very quick and precise answer on our enquiry E-mail before the trvelling. Everithing is very near to the Hotel, just some minutes of walk. The locality of the Hotel is EXCELLENT. Even the breakfast was OK for there were several nearby places where we could drink tasty fresh coffee (coffee with milk) with thousand kinds of bakery products. I can suggest it warmly for everybody who has not special needs (!) and wish to get accomodation for relatively cheap price. We plan to go back next year surely and we want to choose just this one place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money. Clean and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Scruffydog777
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights starting may 5th. Room was very clean and well lit. Looked like hotel was recently refurbished. Everything clean and shiny. There was looked to be a brand new a.c. unit but I didn't need it with temperatures in the low 60s. Double paned window, so a.c. would probably work well. Window looked out over inner court yard, nothing to view really. Owner was freindly and helpful and spoke English well. Hotel is about a 20 to 25 minute walk from station, though a pleasent and scenic one. You can take a waterbus to shorten the walk considerably. They have a transportation system set up in Venice just like in any big city but it's all on water with waterbus stations at numerous locations that make frequent stops making it easy to get around. No tv but who needs it? In a good location with lots to do all around. No internet but an internet cafe very close by that charges 2 euros for 30 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Typical venetian style, good price/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: JakobK14
Reviews.Content: Decorated in typical old Venetian style. 2 minutes from Rialto, nice view and everythings close. Helpfull personal.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CarlisleMurray
Reviews.Content: We paid 90 euros a night for room only, the room was in a venetian style with on-suite nice and clean, not much of a view as it looked on to an internal courtyard (room 21) but this ment it was nice and quiet. The reception staff were helpful and polite, we got stranded because of the volcanic ash and they helped us out and didn't increase their prices like some other hotels did. Great Location for everything 5 - 10 min walk to Rialto water bus or 15 min walk to F. Nove for Airport water bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place, slightly let down by servce”
Reviews.Author: PamSco
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great little hotel. Probably not too expensive for Venice. The room was exactly as expected, the superior canal view room (No 2 in the annex) is as per the picture on the hotel website. It was warm and comfortable. Two tiny details which did not hinder our enjoyment but would have made a great stay special. Cigarette burns on the bedding, though I hasten to add the room did not smell of smoke at all - probably old burns. There was no soap/shampoo provided in the bathroom. I would usually nip to reception to ask for soap but we had been informed that reception would be closed and had been given a mobile number for the owner in case of need Phoning an italian mobile would cost more than popping out and buying our own, which we did. As I said, a small detail. Our stay was pleasant and we didn't have any contact with anyone who worked in the hotel until check out. The member of staff appeared extremely busy and was therefore terse with us. We shouldn't have interrupted her phone call (which was not stopped) with such trivial matters as paying. In summary though we would probably stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “clean and tidy, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: ricardo1953
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well located and well maintained and relatively well priced. However our room was situated above a main thoroughfare and this meant there was constant noise until 3.00am every night. There was no double glazing to kill the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: doogieluxembourg
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in this hotel with my mother, room 11 superior, very well decorated (XVIII century venetian style), private bathroom, very clean and proper. We just loved! The hotel is very well located, you can reach all main city attractions within 10 minutes walk. Perfect location. The price was not bad for Venice. The hotel doensÂ´t offer breakfast but we didnÂ´t consider it very relevant. I definitely recommend this hotel. I.Vitoriano

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location”
Reviews.Author: pandasnack
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel for its location-- an easy walk to St. Marks, to Ca' d'Oro vaporetto and even to the ferry to Murano. We found the hotel easily using the directions from the hotel. Apparently, the directions from the airport are not as good. We got a pretty good sized room for 3. The bathroom and room were clean and well appointed. One trick: the air conditioner which I thought was broken actually worked (Mr. Kumar gave us good directions). There is no internet access at the hotel. Our room was actually not in the hotel proper but across the street. It was a bit noisy at night if you left the windows open (we had the campiello view room). If you turned on the air, you could sleep better. I would stay here again, because the price was very good for the central location. If you have a lot of luggage-- there is no elevator-- so be warned. I was lucky enough to have the manager carry my bag up.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Al Vagon!”
Reviews.Author: Monica M
Reviews.Content: Love, Love, Loved the Al Vagon - Great location - just minutes from Rialto. We stayed in the new section of the Hotel and friends stayed in the older section, both rooms were lovely. Large by european standards, great bathroom with linens changed daily. Staff was friendly and helpful. Love my canal view. some may find the noise from the restaurant below a bit much, but I enjoyed it, they had someone singing in Italian in the evening. Loved listening to the sounds of the boats cruising through the canal. The windows opened so I did not find the need for airconditioning though each room had their own controls.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Hotel al Vagon!”
Reviews.Author: SarBlair
Reviews.Content: Me and my 2 sisters couldn't believe this was a 1 star hotel! We got a double standard room with extra bed, and it was beautiful. We didn't pay for air conditioning, but we got it anyway, perhaps we were upgraded and they forgot to mention it! It doesn't serve breakfast but there were plenty of little shops and cafes around selling croissants etc. we actually took enough cereal bars with us to last the whole trip! There was also a Billa supermarket just a couple of minutes away up the strada nova which was a good place to buy cheap water and food for picnics. In the same square as the hotel was a decent pizza place which we ate at almost everyday. The square was a bit noisy in the evenings but we went to bed at about midnight and it was ok by that time. We were so tired from walking everywhere that the noise didn't bother us, we just fell straight to sleep! The hotel was in a great area, there are plenty of restaurants in the canneregio district that are more honestly priced, yet it was only a stones throw from the Rialto bridge, and we were able to get to everywhere we wanted to visit on foot (apart from the Lido haha). We would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone travelling on a budget, or indeed, anyone not travelling on a budget as it was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “nice but cold”
Reviews.Author: CemTRAnkara
Reviews.Content: Location and the decoration of the room are the pros of our stay, but the heater and the said air condition were centrally locked. when I talked about it with the reception, they said they were not allowed to be used in that season. You pay 140â‚¬ per night and you get a cold in the room. (by the way, the weather was not bad outside but the interiors were cold especially at night.)

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else on my next trip, it was the best!”
Reviews.Author: girlsweekvenice
Reviews.Content: Wow, this hotel and it's family ownership was fantastic. Maurizio the owner, we think, was like our personal concierge, so helpful we couldn't have done Venice without him. The rooms were tastefully decorated, we had a full bath and they were cleaned and maintained impeccably. We were with our mother and Maurizio gave us the key/remote to work the lift so that my mother could get easier to the second floor. The area of town that the Hotel is in, is so convenient, there are lots of eating areas and shops and a bank right in the Campo that our hotel was in, and the beer was cheap in our little cafe, in the same square. The hotel was very close to either the Rialto or Ca D'Oro vaporetto stop so it was easier to get anywhere and it was only a 10 minute walk to either Fondamente Nouve(Murano/Burano/Airport connections) or Piazza San Marco. If I ever were to return to Venice I wouldn't stay anywhere else other than the Hotel Al Vagon, because of it's location and friendly ownership. Also, Maurizio's niece Jovanna runs the attached restaraunt with her father, mother, brother and it was superb with much the same personal service as the hotel. Jovanna gave us a very personal experience for our mother's 65th Birthday dinner and we are very appreciative. All in all a 4 star experience for a 1 star price. Thank you Maurizio and Jovanna.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in a Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: mrdarcydog
Reviews.Content: As a younger female traveling solo in Venice â€“ okay, I had my 3 kg dog with me â€“ I would absolutely recommend Hotel Al Vagon. I stayed there in November 2008 for 7 nights and then again in December for 2 additional nights. The hotelâ€™s location is outstandingâ€¦on the main drag between the train station and Rialto, but at the same time it is very easy to get away from the crowds and explore a less traveled Venice (look for Santa Maria dei Miracoli). The hotel is just a couple minutes from the Caâ€™ dâ€™Ora vaporetto stop, and the traghetto stop to San Polo and the Rialto Fish Market is even closer. Love the traghetti â€“ they are cheap, convenient, and you get the experience of being on a gondola in the water for a few precious minutes. While getting lost in Venice is both rewarding and completely frustrating, those yellow signs leading to Rialto and/or the train station make it much easier to find your way back to the hotel â€“ I found this very helpful. My first stay at Hotel Al Vagon was in a smaller room with two single beds â€“ basic and cozy but perfectly fine, especially for the great price (off season and a 5% cash discount). The room was clean, the shower was always hot, and happily, there was very good water pressure. The room might be a bit small for two people, but there was a full size wardrobe and a desk which kept things organized. I kept the window cracked open to hear the Santi Apostoli church bells, but overnight watch out for the mosquitoes â€“ even in the winter one sneaky little guy found his way in and had a nice meal at my expense â€“ but it was worth it. For my second stay I was joined by my sister; we booked a double room with a canal view. We were upgraded to a superior double in the annex around the corner and the room was great! The high ceilings and the huge windows with a view over the canal made us very, very happy! The room was clean, pretty, and quite comfortable for two people and a little dog. And again, the shower was always hot with very good water pressure. We were given keys to the room and the outside door, so it actually felt more like being in an apartment than a hotel, something we both appreciated. Note there was no elevator and steep stairs to the room (just one flight up) but there was a fixed chair lift if one needed it. The weather was cold during both of my stays, but I was impressed that the hotel was nicely (and not overly) heated. Al Vagon doesnâ€™t offer a breakfast, but no worries, there are many caffes and bakeries (try El Forner de Canton on the Strada Nova) all around the hotel â€“ have your breakfast like a local for a couple of euro and try something new each day. The owner of the hotel, and his staff, were wonderful! I always felt comfortable, safe, and welcomed, especially as a single female traveler. I travel independently and donâ€™t need much hand holding in regards to sites and food, but things do come up. For instance, when I asked to leave a small bag at the hotel (for three weeks) until my next stay, the owner, Maurizio, immediately accommodated the request. And, for my second stay, we arrived at the beginning of an Aqua Alta, with another scheduled for the next morning. Maurizio had rain boots ready for usâ€¦and we definitely needed them! My boots were lime green with hot pink trim â€“ silly, but I loved them â€“ enough so that when I asked Maurizio if I could take them home, he said yes! They were one of the best things I brought home with me â€“ a true reminder of Venice! For the price, Hotel Al Vagon is a great find in magical city â€“ I would return in second.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: lilo84
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights in May 2008. The good things about this hotel are: the location and the price. I didn't have very high expectations when I booked this so I was pretty fine with it. We had a basic room with two beds which weren't very comfortable. Would have preferred one bed. Our room was small, simple and clean. The staff weren't the most helpful or friendliest people. The directions they give to get to the hotel are great and easy to follow. Would I stay here again? Probably not as I'd prefer to stay somewhere with a bit of a view and also that included a breakfast . If you're just looking for somewhere simple, clean and in a good location for a decent price this place is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jv_blues
Reviews.Content: We booked the simplest room for two people and were not disappointed for the price we paid (50 euros/nite). Though the room IS small, fitting just a bed, desk and dresser, it was a good sleep. If you sleep before 11/12midnight though, there is loud music coming from the juice bar below. However, closing the shutters makes a big difference. The room and bathroom was spotless! If you need a hairdryer or adapter, you just need to ask reception. Only disappointment was that there was no t.v. for the early nights that we retired, many places and restaurants in Venice closed early when we went. It seemed that this was especially true when it rained.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: arn22
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the experience at this place was the worst I've had - ever! We were supposed to stay here 3 nights, but walked out after 2. Here's what happened - We reached the hotel following the directions from the hotel website - which was accurate. Got our standard room with canal view (not that great) which was in the main building. The room was probably the worst one we've stayed in so far. It had a weird smell and seemed really old, dirty and sub-standard. Anyway, we checked in at around 9 pm - freshened up, got a map of Venice and headed out. The location of the hotel is good - just 3-4 mins to Rialto bridge. We dined at one of the fancy restaurants by the bridge, since it was both our birthdays. Anyhow, we got back around 10:30 pm and were told that we would need to move to another rooom the next day due to some "maintenance" work. We had an early morning tour booking and said we wouldn't be there to move our stuff, etc. The guy told us to pack our stuff and keep it ready and they would move it for us. Anyhow, the next day we got up real early, got ready, packed and left at 8. We got back at 2 pm, and were greeted by a lady at the front desk who had no clue what room we were supposed to be in. After explaining for a few mins (handactions mainly, since she didn't understand English) - she took was to our room - which was a Double Superior in another building. This room was great and much better than the one we had previously. We stopped by the room for sometime, and then headed off to St. Marks again. Got back later that night, and the same front desk guy from the previous night told us that we could settle the bill tomorrow after 9 am(though we still had 2 more nights to go) since no one would be available at the hotel front desk - weird. This guy seemed odd, creepy and made us feel really uncomfortable. Well, we decided to settle the bill with him that night since we had an early morning tour again the next day. We went to the front desk at 10 pm - paid him for 3 nights, took our bill, thanked him for the new room and left for dinner. We got back to our room at 11 pm. For some strange reason, the same guy at the front desk called our room 3-4 times AFTER 11:30 pm. We were half asleep and didn't realise what was going on. Finally, my husband picked up the phone at 11:30 pm (since he called 4 times non-stop, and we probably thought it was an emergency - READ: Immediate evacuations?!!) He starts by telling my husband that we wanted to talk to us - so could he come to our room???? Can you even imagine that? We have stayed at 100+ hotels so far, and never has anyone from the front desk bothered us this late with a request to drop by our room at midnight! My husband was rightfully pissed off, and asked him why the hell was he is disturbing us at midnight! The guy then started mumbling, that he wanted to give us a 5% discount. Can you believe that? My husband got really angry and just hung up. He then called again - and went on to say - that he wanted to give us a discount since we belonged to the same country (India) and that I had apparently asked him about his wife and kids (I don't remember doing that - since I'm not a social, talk to strangers type of person!) My husband was stumped and went on to say that obviously, since we could afford a trip to Italy, a discount of 10 Euros being offered at midnight, would make no difference to our finances. Anyway, whatever this guy mumbled, didn't seem true at all - and totally messed us up. I am not sure what his motives were, but we felt extremely unsafe. My husband asked to be checked out and refunded for the 3rd night, but this guy went on to say that he was "leaving" for the night, and that we need to talk to the owner (Marcus?). This was absurd and another lie, since he didn't really go home. We stayed up all night, packed and waited for dawn. We left first thing in the morning at 7 am. We walked to the front desk - and as expected he was there. Without uttering a single word, all he did was return our money for the 3rd night, gave us a new bill - that's it. My guess is that he didn't want us to talk to his owner about this, and that's why refunded our 3rd night so quickly. We had thought of coming back and talking to the owner later that day - telling him about how his staff had treated us, the incovenience and disturbance caused the previous night, but were in no mood to come anywhere close to this hotel and ruin our mood again. This was a horrible experience - and I did find it difficult feeling safe at the next few places that we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: citybreak123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an ideal location, close to the Rialto bridge and vaparetto stops. We were accommodated in a block a 10 second walk around the corner from the hotel itself and given a key to the door to the block so we could come and go as we pleased. The room itself was small but perfectly adequate for our needs. It was very clean and towels were changed daily, if required. We had a canal view and could stand at the window and see the boats below. The room was heated and had air conditioning. All hotel staff were polite and very helpful. We arrived early to leave our bags and found the room was already ready for us. On our departure we left our bags at the hotel for the morning and then collected them before our flight. For transport around Venice I recommend buying a 2/3 day vaparetto ticket. This hop on/hop off service is an ideal way to see all of Venice and the outlying islands.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ddaily007
Reviews.Content: Simple but nice room with view of canal. Clean. No complaints. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: QuebecDany
Reviews.Content: Almost perfection, clean, well located and the owners very gracious! Nothing more could be expected. The restaurant was very good(ate once) and we had a superior room on the canal side so we really felt we were in Venice. I do understand why they have only one star (they don't serve breakfast) but they deserve 3 or 4 stars for everything else. Especially if you compare to most other hotels with more stars, higher price but so so breakfast. Anyway coffee and croissant are easy to find very close by at a decent price. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Al Vagon”
Reviews.Author: MaryK_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Al Vagon hotel for 2 nights....we looking for forward to seeing Venice, and our 2 previous hotels were great in another parts of Italy, so we put alot of expectation for this stop. Wow, we were so pleased, we had a speedy check in and the owner even helped us bring our luggage up to our room. Our room was very spacious, and had a full size bathroom and fabulous view. We were amazed how beautiful the view was and how much better it made our stay! Everything was a short walk away; Rialto Bridge, San Marco Square, and great places to eat all within a short walk. Even just steps away were the Gondoliers! which you can see right out of your window. We really enjoyed our stay at Al Vagon, they were helpful with all our questions, and the room was spotless not to mention the location was fantastic. I would recommend this hotel to anyone interested in staying here and would retun myself.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: newport.david
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Al Vagon for 2 nights. The first night we booked a delux double with canal view for around Â£80. The room was spotless, in a traditional style, and very nice - also plenty of space. Nice big double windows opened right onto a canal with gondolas passing, and to the left very closely a nice little bridge and a square with a restaurant etc... The second night, a last minute thing, we saved money by booking a smaller room for about Â£55. To me, the room was just as good only smaller - and I actually preferred it. The view was just as good. Both rooms have air con and very good sound proofing. Both rooms had ensuite which was clean and functional if not inspired - I think larger shower cubicles would be a good idea - I mean Venice is a Romantic place - it was slightly annoying for 2 of us to try and squash in a small shower cubicle. Also power showers would be good. This did not spoil it though. The location of the hotel is the best aspect - it could not have been better placed - right in the centre of busy shopping lanes one way, over the footbridge the other way to a nice square and another busy area of restaurants, shops, and a supermarket (plus plenty of bridges to watch the sunset from). The hotel was not a traditional one - it was more like renting a room - we then had keys to a seperate entrance located next to the Al Vagon restaurant so it felt like you were almost living there - I liked that a great deal, but I guess some people might want a traditional style hotel with porters, lifts, etc... All in all I thought this place was great value - it's smack bang in the middle of Venice and the best room was Â£80. The smaller room was great and at Â£55 for central venice I thought it was great. The staff were friendly and helpful and responded quickly to my email enquiries. I would definitly stay here again - I wandered most of Venice and the location is definitly one of if not the best. We walked around nearly the whole of central Venice and did all of that by foot so the hotel is very central wherever you wish to go. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: margs914
Reviews.Content: My family just stayed in this hotel for one night, and I thought it was pretty nice. We're 18, 22 and 50's, just for extra perspective. The location was wonderful as pretty much everything was in walking distance. The hotel was very clean and the staff and management were very nice, including in our email communications. Though the wait to check into your room can seem like a bit long if you arrive in venice early, they were very helpful and let us leave our bags at the reception desk while we explored during the wait. The room was somewhat sparsely furnished, though pretty big, but I didnt really have a problem with that as I didnt expect to be watching tv or anything during my stay, I was out in the city! The bathroom was very nice, or at least I didnt notice any problems, maybe the shower was a bit small, but thats true of most of the hotels I stayed in on our trip and wasnt really an issue. We had a very nice canal view and noise wasnt a problem, which is saying something as I am a very light sleeper. I would have liked to be better informed that there wouldnt be any air conditioning in our room, but it came with a fan and we were provided with a second one as well when we asked. That worked pretty well for me. If I had any issues it may have been with the bed, which wasnt excellent as it seems to have been a bit old, but as I said, Im a very light sleeper and I slept reasonably well, so it didnt really affect my view of the hotel. Our room wasnt much like those pictured on the site, then again we had a standard 3 person room, and the pictures seem to be of a superior rate room. I had a wonderful stay in Venice and liked the hotel and staff, especially the hotels location. I would recommend asking for air conditioning when you book though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location & View”
Reviews.Author: Kerryman78
Reviews.Content: There was quite a bit of drama ahead of our arrival at this hotel in that Venice was covered in fog, resulting in a diversion to Genoa and a 5hour bus ride to arrive around 4.30 am at Piazzale Roma. Waterbuses were still operating and we disembarked at the Caâ€™ Dâ€™oro stop. Happily the directions on the hotel website were quite accurate even in the dark of the night and with fog-reduced visibility. We found the hotel entrance in the small square and the porter quickly let us in and showed us to our room, which was in another building around the corner. Needless to say, we saw little that night. Next morning, when we opened the shutters, we had a wonderful view of the canal with a nice bridge and gondolas passing by (I had requested a canal view at time of booking). The room itself was fine (Double Standard with Canal View), the furniture quaint, the bathroom modern and spacious. No complaints. The location is excellent, maybe 5-10 to minutes walk to St Markâ€™s Square, less to Rialto. Everywhere is accessable on foot along small narrow streets and if you wish to see further afield, the waterbuses go to places such as Murano (glass-making island). We were surprised to find Venice so busy in early February as it was very cold, though the fog did add an air of romance. We were departing from Treviso, so again it was quite easy to get a waterbus from the Caâ€™ Dâ€™oro stop to Piazzale Roma. (Note you must buy the bus ticket from the ticket office, they wouldnâ€™t sell them from the bus at that time). While the fog had cleared the previous day, it descended again that evening and required an overnight stay in Treviso, before a successful departure the following morning.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the midst but still a little haven”
Reviews.Author: lizardoqueen
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel. Step outside and you're right on the main walkway towards The Rialto and S Marco Piazza. But you can also sit at the hotel's restaurant and take in a quiet, secluded canal moment. The staff were helpful enough and the room itself was very clean and pretty, Venetian style. The bathroom was also clean and modern. Our view was of a not so pretty internal courtyard but there was lots of light. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: pinkieandrorytravels
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Vagon for 2 nights in April. We found the hotel to be great value for money, in a fantastic location. We stayed in a superior room which was nicely decorated and cleaned both days. The hotel is located a 5 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and 10 minutes to St Marks Square. The reception staff were both friendly and helpful. Great choice for a good value stay in Venice, we will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: ebsLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the al vagon for 2 nights and it was perfect! The room (standard double) was spotless, only slightly small but we only needed to sleep in there! The canal view was wonderful and the noise (not bad at all) was cut out immediately after shutting the shutter and window itself. If too hot there is always the air-con. The room also had a small safe for valuables which was very useful. The staff were very friendly and helpful, we were able to leave our luggage with reception before check-in and after check-out. The bathroom was great. Very clean indeed and the shower had a shower panel. We stayed in room 8 and had a very pleasant stay. The hotel is a 5 minute walk away from the Rialto Bridge and the Grand canal. Therefore the location was perfect and great value. There are plenty of places to grab a morning coffee and a panini or croissant for breakfast. Lot's of reasonable and cheap Pizza places near by and loads of quality ice cream places so you won't go starving! They also have very lovely fish menus, we had the most amazing lobster by the canal!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean hotel but our room was very small”
Reviews.Author: TravellerWiltshire0
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were surprised to find that our "superior" room was in a block away fromt he main hotel. You enter this block from a narrow alleyway, going up an old stone staircase. Once we entered the main door to the rooms it opened up to a pleasantly decorated corridor and we began to be more hopeful that the room would be as shown on the web page. We were disappointed to find that our room No 16 was very tiny with a double bed pushed against the wall and overlooked the narrow alleyway so very little natural light. That said the bathroom was immaculate and looked to be newly refurbished and all was very clean. Despite our initial disappointment with the size of the room we found the location very good and also for Venice extremely quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, friendly staff, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: StingRay_DR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at a smal square in the middle of town, very close to the Rialto Bridge. The hotel is simple and small (18 rooms). The staff is very friendly, the rooms are kept clean very well. Our bathroom had a shower, bidet, toilet and a washbowl. Water supply is good, warm and cold 24/7. Rooms with view on a small canal and some with view on a small but busy lane. Very attractive to watch from your window ;-). Price/quality ratio is good. the only thing you can do there is bathe and sleep< just what we were looking for!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKALondon
Reviews.Content: This was our seventh stay at hotel Al Vagon. The hotel is well located, just 5 minutes walk from Rialto and 10 minutes from St Mark's Square. (If noise is an issue for you this may be a problem as the hotel is on a main route). There are plenty of bars and restaurants near by whatever you are looking for - coffee and a brioche, chichetti at the bar, pizza and ice cream or a traditional meal. We have stayed in two of the superior rooms in the annexe with views of a small canal. The rooms have always been clean and are a reasonable size with high ceilings. The bathrooms (shower) though compact have fully working plumbing. The only slight issue is some of the towels could be replaced with softer ones. We have always found the staff to be helpful and friendly. We hope to return soon for our eight visit in four years.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: rost_fryd
Reviews.Content: During Easter my boyfriend and I (age 34 and 30) stayed at Hotel Al Vagon for a week. We had a very pleasant stay! The room was nice and clean with a view to the canal, and the bathroom was nice as well. Great service and friendly hotel staff. I'm very surprised that the hotel only has one star, at least two would be right if you compare to hotels in other European cities such as Barcelona and Paris. The location is perfect for a visit i Venice, 10 minutes walk from the San Marco Square, which also means that the area is not too crowded with tourists. Just besides the reception is a small coffee shop and wine bar that serves nice coffee at affordable prices, and there are lots of local wine bars and restaurants with fine prices in the area if you want to go out with the locals instead of the tourists. We can only recommend this hotel; if we're coming back to Venice we'll definately book our room at Hotel Al Vagon.

Reviews.Title: “great as expected”
Reviews.Author: jo_802
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice and I had a good experience both times. The rooms with shower were clean. The location was excellent, not too far from the boat station and quite near rialto. There was even a cheap pizza place/coffee shop just outside the hotel, which was good for budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: KatyaNYC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Vagon was a great value. Our room was clean, and pleasant. The hotel is well-located, very near the Rialto Bridge and lots of activity, and yet the room was very quiet. The owner was personable and attentive. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value for the $!”
Reviews.Author: RenaissanceMomNYC
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently traveled to Italy and had a most charming stay at this hotel. We had a lovely room with private bath in the annex - super clean and nicely appointed. The room was perfectly quiet and peaceful to sleep in, yet was excellently located so that stepping outside the door one was right in the center of Venice. Our host, Mauritzio, was friendly and helpful from the start and we felt right at home. All in all, a really great accomodation for the budget-minded traveler, and I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Right Htoel in the right place”
Reviews.Author: vongoliere
Reviews.Content: I've been in venice for three days and I've spent two nights in this Hotel. It's cheap for the place and for the rooms: it's 5 minutes by walk from Piazza San Marco, 1 minutes from Ponte di Rialto and exactly in the middle of the town. The rooms are clean with good furnitures and bathroom is enough to relax yourself after a Venice-day. So I recommend it to people who want to stay in Venice with a good price, good location and who doesn't want to find surprises after booking: it's exactly as it's described! Boris

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent room”
Reviews.Author: cardidj
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alvagon is situated close to Rialto but in a rather quiet zone. You can easily reach everywhere by foot or vaporetto (Rialto and CÃ  D'oro stations are near the hotel) and there are lots of nice restaurants and cichetterie in the neighbourhood. Our room was basic but very clean, and with incredible views to the canal!. We stayed for five nights and I reccomend it to anyone who looks for a cheap and clean place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: david_liddle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb location. A couple of minutes walk from the Rialto bridge, you have access to all areas. The hotel is of good standard, clean rooms and cleaned daily. We also had a shower/toilet area. The hotel staff were always there to help and extremely polite and helpful. We had no problems checking in early and our flight was not until 11pm and the hotel staff let us leave our bags until our departure. We stayed in room number 29 which met our requirements. If you are a young couple looking for somewhere to stay, in a great location and not fussed about all the amenities, that a more expensive hotel would offer, then this is the perfect choice. Yes, there are boats that pass by in the morning and there is a clock that chimes early on, however this should be a wake up call for you to go out and investigate Venice. We walked all over Venice in our two days and the hotel acts as a central point.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: TexHwyMan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Al Vagon is a great find in the heart of Venice. Located just a five minute walk north of the Rialto Bridge, the Al Vagon is in a great location for exploring the city. My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon in mid October 2007. We booked a â€œsuperiorâ€� double room with a private bath and a canal view. When we arrived, the owner was efficient but friendly and showed us to our room located in the annex, which is in the same building but around back from the reception desk and above the canal-side Al Vagon restaurant. All of the rooms in the annex are on the second floor, which does require you to climb a set of steep stairs. There was an elevator chair available for those with disabilities. We were in room #4, which was decent-sized with high ceilings, tiled floor, and two tall windows overlooking a canal. The walls had a number of scratches and dings from luggage, but those were purely aesthetic blemishes. The double bed was, in typical European fashion, really just two twin beds pushed together with a queen-size headboard. The bed was a bit hard, which was fine for me because of some back problems I had been having, but for my wife was a little rough. Still, it was comfortable enough that we both slept fine. The room had a small TV with several international stations (including CNN) and a safe. The view of the canal was nice, but because of the thick walls of the building, did require one to lean out of the window a bit to get a good view. There was air conditioning and an in-room thermostat, but as we came in October, it was not available and certainly not needed. However, it was chilly at night, and the heating also was not yet available due to government regulations. The en suite bathroom included toilet, sink, shower, and hair dryer, but the bidet had been removed (not that we missed it.) The shower was not enclosedâ€”rather, it was simply a low spot in the floor with a drain and shower head, which meant that after using it, the entire bathroom was quite wet. However, the water pressure was good and hot water primed quickly. The hair dryer, according to my wife, was awkword and mostly ineffective. The room was very clean when we arrived and was cleaned daily. At night, it was mostly quiet, but being above the canal meant some noise from the occasional passing motorboat. Also, being over the restaurant meant some crowd noise until about 10:30 each night. But overall, with the windows closed, it wasnâ€™t too terribly noisy and as we are heavy sleepers, it certainly did not disturb our sleep, but a light sleeper may have some difficulty. The most noise actually came from the neighboring roomâ€™s water pipes. The hotel does not serve breakfast, but we enjoyed finding breakfast at the little bakery/coffee shops on our way to the dayâ€™s sightseeing. Overall, we found the Hotel Al Vagon to be a great value for the price and recommend it to anyone looking for a relatively inexpensive but quality room in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: IowaDesMoines
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location. We stayed with friends in two rooms overlooking the courtyard. The rooms were very nice and everyone was friendly. It is not a full service hotel. It has a reception area and rooms. We were out all day and used the hotel for sleeping. We were very pleased particularly considering the cost of hotels in Venice. We would recommend the hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: mondo12
Reviews.Content: Very strange place, We arrived around lunch time and there was nobody there only a cleaner with no english who grunted at us a few times, after about an hour a man arrived,the same guy in the picture at the reception who I presume is the manager,he was unfriendly and was acting very suspicious of us without any reason! We had booked a double room for two nights but he told us we could only have a double for the first night and spend the second in a twin room! The rooms are the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel,especially the twin room on the second night,we could not fit in the room at with our luggage! Had to keep luggage in bathroom!!!! The bathroom was like a shoebox also, the shower head was almost directly above the toilet,no shower tray,curtain etc..so the whole place got flooded when the shower was used. We done our best to see the funny side of all this gladly it was a short stay. Apart from all the negativity Venice is well worth seeing just dont stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in central Venice”
Reviews.Author: nicoleb83
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. The rooms are extremely clean and very cutely decorated. I was surprised to receive daily maid service at a one-star hotel, but we came home every day to made-up beds and a sparkling-clean private bathroom. The double room includes two very narrow twin-size beds pushed together, but you can separate them slightly if you are not romantic with your travel partner, although the room is not very large. I was also pleasantly surprised to find that the room included air conditioning which was nice to have at night. Despite being centrally located in Venice (very close to the Rialto Bridge, fifteen-minute walk from St. Mark's Square and Accademia), the room was quiet. Since we had air conditioning, we didn't need to leave the windows open, which helped block out sound from the building's courtyard. My only complaint was that we couldn't make outgoing calls from the room's phone, and there was no wireless internet in sight. Nearby amenities included a majorly overpriced internet point, and some of the best gelato I've ever had in the square where the hotel office is.

Reviews.Title: “What a joke!”
Reviews.Author: corcaighabu
Reviews.Content: Be Aware!!! Booked hotel two months before trip to Venice. Got my confirmation email for a three night stay over a weekend in May for my girlfriend and I. Then all of a sudden two days before we were to depart Ireland,I received an email from Maurizio at the front desk acknowledging our cancelation! I promptly emailed back stating that I never canceled our three nights stay. After numerous phone calls,the only answer he could give was that the system changed it and there was nothing he could do as he was fully booked out now. Just think my frustration, having booked this trip for our anniversary. Trying to find another hotel in such short notice was extremely hard and we eventually ended up paying massive prices for a room you wouldn't leave a dog sleep in! It is obviously this hotels policy to over-book and then cancel peoples rooms at the last minute,blaming the "system" for their greediness! I called to Maurizio and gave him a piece of my mind and more when I did arrive in Venice, ruining young peoples trips like this is a disgrace! Be very careful when so called booking with this hotel,I certainly wouldn't chance it again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bballer21
Reviews.Content: Our room (a triple) was very small. The curtains were not clean and the walls were bare. The hotel is in a good location if you want to be away from St. Marks and even then its only about a ten minute walk. Very close the Rialto though. I would probably stay here again though if the prices stay the same. You get what you pay for though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajjc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay at this hotel. We arrived at reception tired, hot and thirsty, the man at reception was polite and efficient, he slowly took our passport details and then explained we would be staying in a room across the courtyard. He showed us to the building across the road, explained the 3 keys, one for the front door, one for the door to our floor and one to our room and left us to it. The room was lovely and I would say recently refurbished, canopy over the bed, really romantic feel to it. All in all the room was a perfect, beautifully decorated, maid service and fresh towelâ€™s every day The only problem was the bed, we had booked a double room, we expected a double bed, it was in fact 2 single beds pushed together and made up to seem a double bed. In fact it was the most uncomfortable bed we have ever slept in, only one pillow each (we need two), we used a rolled up blanket instead, (unfortunately the maid didnâ€™t take the hint and bring extra pillows, but we never asked) We explored every day so really just used the room to sleep & change in the evening, we never ate in the restaurant or had contact with reception except to check in and out or so canâ€™t comment on that aspect. In Venice everything is expensive so this hotel is a great deal, and a good base to explore Venice We stayed in room 11 in the building adjacent the hotel, I would stay there again, no problem, and would recommend it as great value for money in Venice, but if staying for any longer I would have complained and insisted on a double bed with a comfortable mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Old but livable”
Reviews.Author: RahulAgrawal
Reviews.Content: Dont go by the pictures on the web site. It is a budget hotel but the room is very bad and is not even close to how it looks on the web site. It is in a good location close to rialto bridge. Out of all the hotels I booked while ion my europe trip this was the worst but it was clean and small with few broken tiles and walls.

Reviews.Title: “good value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: my_cat_misses_me
Reviews.Content: We were expecting Venice to be significantly more expensive than other Italian cities, so were pleasantly surprised by the competitive rates at Al Vagon. Admittedly, the room was very small (about 8' by 18') but it had a canal view, a good bed, and adequate light for reading. The location is terrific--steps to the Rialto--with good choices for meals, coffee and snacks close by. The staff was helpful with advice about trains.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: il0vetravel
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a very central Venice location. Easy walk to vaperetto station to catch transporation to San Marco Square and other parts of Venice. Room was very nice and air conditioning worked well. Management (owner) was very helpful. Don't be afraid get a tourist map from the hotel and wander the streets and canals around the area. You can walk all the way to the outside of the island and catch a vaperetto to Murano or Burano. Its an easy and lovely walk. Look into purchasing a Venice Card for unlimited transportation and discounts to attractions and musesums.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty and central”
Reviews.Author: DoylerWaterford
Reviews.Content: Know its late in the day, but stayed here for a romantic weekend in Venice just before Christmas 2005. We booked a superior room and it was lovely, clean and central,the only issue was no breakfast. You can get that no problem locally. The restaurant Al Vagon wasn't a great experience but maybe its better in the summer with more atmo. The place is cheap and pretty with a great central location(we were alone on Rialto Bridge next to it in the eerie Venitian fog our first night).It felt totally safe. Go to Venice in December, it was gorgeous in low season. By the way, we are married seventeen years, so did have realistic expectations! The Al Vagon is value for money and a handy spot.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: infolondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location (once I found it), within easy walking distance of Rialto Bridge and St Markâ€™s Square. Many eating places are nearby and the hotel overlooks a small canal on one side. I rung and managed to obtain a standard room with a canal view. The room was quite small, with en-suite toilet and shower, but was perfectly adequate for our needs. The shower was quite powerful, which was certainly a plus. The view from our room of the canal is slightly restricted due to the window blinds / doors, and how they opened, but it was still a good view, and worth the money we paid. The man at the hotel speaks good English, whereas another lady at reception didnâ€™t. But both were friendly and helpful. I have no complaints in regards to cleanliness. One problem I did have is that it can be pretty noisy. On the first evening we were kept awake by a nearby bar playing music (A Friday evening), but the same noise didnâ€™t occur on the Saturday or Sunday night of our stay. Also due to its location, it is just generally noisy outside, so light sleepers be aware. In summary if you are looking for a cheap, basic, but very central hotel, this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Al Vagon should be 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: BallsinKyville
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the nicest we stayed in while in Italy. Accomodations were excellant and the people were willing to go above and beyond to please their guests. Location was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nikir
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe the bad reviews about this hotel! It is a fabulous place to stay and the staff couldn't be any nicer.My husband took me here for my birthday and what a brilliant city. The rooms are wonderful (we had a superior room),we were with two other cou ples and their rooms although just standard rooms were very nice and big enough.Venice is very expensive for food and drink but we got a great deal for this hotel on their own website.If we ever visit Venice again I would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Al Vagon
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 5619 | Campiello Riccardo Selvatico, 30131 Venice, Italy
